business.headline: Dhanteras 2025: Tax on gold jewellery, coins, ETFs and SGBs explainedGold shopping during Dhanteras is a tradition, but the way your purchase is taxed depends on what you buy. US tariffs not a matter of huge concern: RBI chief downplays impact on IndiaRBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra dismissed jitters over US tariffs imposed under Donald Trump, saying India's domestic-driven economy can withstand trade pressure.

EPFO new rules: Check myths and facts about PF withdrawalsAfter the announcement, social media was flooded with rumours that employees will no longer be able to withdraw their PF after leaving a job. This is not true.

Allu Arjun's Arya inspired me to write Dude, says director Keerthiswaran At the pre-release event of 'Dude' in Hyderabad, debutant director Keerthiswaran shared that Allu Arjun's 'Arya' was his inspiration to write his film 'Dude'. general news.headline: Rahul Gandhi dials Lalu Yadav to resolve Bihar seat-sharing deadlock: SourcesRahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge spoke to RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav to resolve the seat-sharing deadlock in Bihar's Grand Alliance, with nominations for the first phase of polls already underway.

Air India crash: Pilot's father approaches Supreme Court seeking judicial inquiryThe pilot's father has demanded that all prior investigations conducted by the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) be treated as closed and that all material evidence be transferred to a judicially monitored committee or court of inquiry headed by a retired Supreme Court judge, with independent aviation and technical experts as members.

Every year a new PM: Trump's epic India-Pakistan mix-up goes viralDonald Trump said India was an incredible country and every single year it saw a new leader. However, it is not India, but Pakistan that fits that description perfectly.

He loves me, but don't want to ruin his career: Trump's off-colour Modi jokeDonald Trump's latest praise for Prime Minister Modi came after he claimed that the latter had assured him India would halt oil purchases from Russia, describing it as a significant boost to his efforts to isolate Moscow in the Ukraine war.

Mumbai man helps woman deliver baby on train platform with doctor on video callAs the pregnant woman's labour progressed while travelling on a train, Vikas Bendre pulled the emergency chain at Mumbai's Ram Mandir Station when the situation became critical.

Trapped in flames: Why bus fires make passengers sitting ducksThe Jaisalmer bus fire, which killed 21 people, exposes why India's buses are deathtraps. The reasons are plenty. While flammable interiors, faulty retrofits, trigger spark, jammed exit doors, overcrowding and lax safety norms make burning buses a deadly trap for passengers. Recurring tragedies, like in Maharashtra's Buldhana which killed 25, one in Nashik, claimed 12 lives, demand urgent safety reforms.

Jalaj Saxena never playing for India surprises ex-selectors: You were chairmanFormer India players and selectors Salil Ankola and Chetan Sharma were surprised that veteran Jalaj Saxena had never represented India internationally, despite being one of the most accomplished players in Ranji Trophy history.

Kohli's 'Won't Give Up' Message: A Bold Signal To Selectors Ahead Of 2027 World Cup?This special report unpacks the speculation surrounding Virat Kohli's future following his cryptic message ahead of the crucial India vs. Australia ODI series. Key figures discussed include Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and former cricketer Madanlal, amidst talk of the 2027 World Cup. Kohli's post stated, 'The only time you truly fail is when you decide to give up.' The programme explores if this is a signal of his intent to play in the 2027 World Cup, his return to the ODI squad alongside Rohit Sharma after both retired from Test and T20I formats, and the challenges ahead. The discussion also features analysis from former cricketer Madanlal, who believes in clear communication between the selectors and senior players like Kohli, and notes that Kohli will not give selectors a chance to drop him based on performance. The report also addresses the selection pressures under the Ajit Agarkar-led committee.

Virat Kohli's viral X post before IND vs AUS ODI series turns out to be an adIndia vs Australia: Hours after landing in Australia ahead of his ODI comeback, Virat Kohli's post on X has gone viral among fans. After multiple hours of flight delay, Indian team arrives late night in PerthThe Indian cricket team arrived in Perth in the early hours of October 16. After multiple hours of delay, a tired Indian team checked into their hotel at 4 am.

UAE inch closer to T20 World Cup after win over Samoa sends Nepal, Oman throughThe UAE will clinch their place at the T20 World Cup on Thursday if they beat Japan in Muscat. Their win over Samoa ensured Nepal and Oman secured their berths for next year's ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
